intro: Arctopoa schischkinii, commonly known as the Schischkin's arctopoa, is a rare and lesser-known species within the Asteraceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly in areas of Kazakhstan and southern Siberia. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with narrow, gray-green leaves and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
